TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/StartPanel/LogOffButtons extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the **Start** menu. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.LogOffButtons class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.LogOffButtons.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelLogOffButtons1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#224](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_116_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#224](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_116_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the hot state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelLogOffButtons2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#225](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/11f05e3c-ee0f-4514-bd0c-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#225](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/11f05e3c-ee0f-4514-bd0c-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the normal state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelLogOffButtons1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#224](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/14d90a07-d26d-472d-82d0-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#224](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/14d90a07-d26d-472d-82d0-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Log Off** and **Shut Down** buttons in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelLogOffButtons3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
